entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
Technologies that have been used for energy generation and distribution for a long time.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
The use of clean and efficient cookstoves and fuels to reduce indoor air pollution and improve health, environment, and livelihoods.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.

energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies

relations.Description: Energy markets collaborate with government agencies to develop and implement policies and regulations that promote a sustainable and efficient energy sector.

relations.Subject: energy storage
relations.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

Mobile wallets are a type of mobile payment system that allows users to store their payment information digitally on their mobile devices. They enable users to make payments conveniently and securely using their smartphones or other mobile devices.
relations.Subject: mobile wallets

relations.Description: Mobile banking is a sub-component of mobile payment systems that enables users to perform banking transactions, such as checking account balances, transferring funds, and paying bills, using their mobile devices. It provides convenient and accessible financial services to individuals, especially those without access to traditional banking services.
relations.Subject: mobile banking

relations.Description: Mobile money transfer is a sub-component of mobile payment systems that allows users to send and receive money using their mobile devices. It provides a convenient and secure way to transfer funds, especially in areas with limited access to traditional banking services.
relations.Subject: mobile money transfer

relations.Description: Mobile payment apps are applications that enable users to make payments using their mobile devices. These apps often integrate with mobile wallets or mobile banking services to provide a seamless payment experience. They offer convenience and flexibility in making transactions.
relations.Subject: mobile payment apps

relations.Description: Contactless payments are a type of mobile payment system that allows users to make transactions by simply tapping their mobile devices or payment cards on a contactless-enabled terminal. It offers a fast and secure payment method, reducing the need for physical contact and enhancing convenience.
relations.Subject: contactless payments
